titles.title: Free Speech Protection Act
Free Speech Protection Act
To amend title 28, United States Code, to set forth the procedure for actions involving covered speech, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary:
Free Speech Protection Act
This bill allows a natural person to bring a civil action against a person or entity that files a defamation claim against that natural person if (1) a court determines that liability is precluded for such defamation claim; and (2) the defamation claim is shown to be filed for the purpose of harassment, intimidation, or otherwise suppressing certain speech related to a matter of legitimate public concern.
